gurmukhi: jw pRB kau inq bHm scIpiq sRI snkwidk hU jpu kIno ] sUr ssI sur nwrd swrd qwhI kY iDAwn ibKY mnu dIno ]
transliteration: Jaa Prabh Kau Nit Brahm Sacheepat(i) Srisankaadik Hoo Jap(u) Keeno|| Soor Sasisur Naarad Saarad Taahikai Dhiaan Bikhai Man(u) Deeno||
translation: He, whose name is muttered ever by Brahma, Indra, Sanak etc.; He, on whom Surya, Chandra, Narada, Sharda meditate;

gurmukhi: Kojq hY ijh is`D mhwmun ibAws prwsur Byd n cIno ] so KVgyS AXoDn mY kr mo ihq kysn qy gih lIno ]1531]
transliteration: Khojat Hai Jih Siddh Mahaamounndbiaas Paraasur Bhed Na Cheeno|| So Khadgsh Ayodhan Mai Kar Mo Hit Kesan Te Gadh Leeno||1531||
translation: He, whom the adepts search in their contemplation and whose mystery is not comprehended by the great sages like Vyas and Prashar, Kharag Singh caught him in the battlefield by his hair.1531.

gurmukhi: mwr bkI bk Aaur AGwsur Dynk ko pl mY bD kIno ] kysI bCwsur must cMfUr kIey ck cUr sunXo pur qIno ]
transliteration: Maar Bakiaur Aghaasur Dhenak Ko Pal Mai Badh Keeno|| Kesibachhaadur Moust Channdoor Keee Chak Choor Sounyo Pur Teeno||
translation: He, who killed Putana, Bakasura, Aghasura and Dhenkasura in an instant; he, who became famous in all the three worlds by killing Keshi, Mahishasur, Mushiti, Chandur etc.;

gurmukhi: sRI hir S`qR Anyk hny iqh kaun gny kib sXwm pRbIno ] kMs kau kysn qy gih kysv BUp mno bdlo vh lIno ]1532]
transliteration: Srihar(i) Shattra Anek Hane Tih Kaoun Gade Kabi Syaam Prabeeno|| Kans Kau Kesan Te Gadh Kesav Bhoop Mano Badlo Vah Leeno||1532||
translation: That Krishna, who had knocked down many enemies with skill and killed Kansa by catching him from his hair; the name Krishna has been caught by his hair by the king Kharag Singh; it seems that he has avenged the killing of Kansa by catching his hair.1532

gurmukhi: icMq krI icq mY BUpq jo idh kau Ab hau bD kY hau ] sYn sBY Bj hY jb hI qb kw sMg jwie kY ju`Du mcY hau ]
transliteration: Chint Karichit Mai Bhoopat Jo Eh Kau Ab Hau Badh Kai Hau|| Sin Sabhai Bhaj Hai Jab Hitab Kaa San Jaae Kai Juddh(u) Macha Hau||
translation: The king then thought that if he killed Krishna, all his army would run away; with whom then he would fight?

gurmukhi: hau ikh pY kirho bhu Gwien kw ky hau Gwie snmuK KY hau ] Cwf dXo kihE jwhu clo hir qo sm sUr khUM nhI pY hau ]1533]
transliteration: Hau Kih Pai Kariho Bahu Ghaain Kaadhau Ghaae Sanmoukh Khai Hau|| Chhaad Dayo Kahio Jaahu Chalo Har(i) To Sam Soor Kahoon Nahipai Hau||1533||
translation: To whom then he would inflict a wound or from whom he be wounded himself? Therefore, the king set Krishna free and said,” Go away, there is no other warrior like you.”1533.

gurmukhi: paurK jYso bfo kIXo BUp n Awgy iksI niRp AYso kIXo ] Bts pyiK kY Bwij gey isgry iknhUM Dnu bwn n pwn lIXo ]
transliteration: Paurakh Jaiso Bado Keeyo Bhoop Na Aage Kisinrip Aiso Keeyo|| Bhatas Pekh(i) Kai Bhaaj Gad Sigre Kinhoon Dhan(u) Baan Na Paan Leeyo||
translation: The great bravery that the king exhibited, was incomparable; seeing this spectacle all the warriors ran away, none of them caught him bow and arrows;

gurmukhi: hQIXwr auqwr cly ibsMBwr rQI rQ twr frwq hIXo ] rn mY KVgyS blI blu kY Apno krkY hir Cwf dIXo ]1534]
transliteration: Hatheeyaar Outaar Chale Bisanbhaar Rathitaar Daraat Heeyo Ran Mai Khadgesh Balibal(u) Kai Apno Kar-kai Har(i) Chhaad Deeyo||1534||
translation: The great fighters, fearing in their mind, abandoned their weapons and fled away and in the battlefield the king set free Krishna with his own will.1534.
